title: Pasta Salad with Tuna
directions: Mix the first 6 ingredients together with the mayo. Measure in enough mayo to make the salad moist but not overwhelmed. Add the herbs, celery seed, salt and pepper to taste. Add the dash of lemon juice and then refrigerate the salad for at least a few hours.
When ready to serve, give the salad another toss, taste to see if you need more seasoning, or more mayo, (it will probably need something) and garnish with the sliced eggs
ingredients: 2 cups pasta curls or elbows (measure out raw) cooked in salted water until just barely al dente
1 small can of your favorite tuna
1/2 large bell pepper or several colorful minis, cut in small dice
2 Tbsp fresh dill, or you can use 1 tsp dried
salt and fresh cracked black pepper
2 or 3 hard boiled eggs, cut in wedges
